--- Colin Green <cgreen@...> wrote:

> Hi Mitchell, All,
> 
> I've intended to look into tasks requiring memory for some time now, and 
> it should be really easy to throw together soem code for SharpNEAT so 
> maybe I'll give this experiment a try. I think I'll try just learning a 
> string of bits (or perhaps more then 2 symbols) without the added 
> complexity of flipping the bits and reversing the sequence. Or have you 
> already succeeded with simpler experiments?

No, I started out with this one.  But it's prolly a good idea to try the simpler one
first.  I'm not sure why I skipped that step.

In my latest version I am having each ANN attempt all possible paths with number of
steps varying from 3 through 8.  My best ANNs get a little over 80% of the bits correct.
 So one of these ANNs, if you gave it any path picked at random, of 3 <= path length <=
8,
it will generate the bits in reverse and inverted, with expection of about 19% erroneous
bits.

I've been using the meta-evolver to pick parameter values for evolution.

That code is now on SVN for anyone to see or download.


Mitchell Timin

I'm proud of http://ANNEvolve.sourceforge.net.  If you want to write software, or articles, or do testing, or research for ANNEvolve, let me know.
